content:
• Friday, July 6, 2018
  • NTGR

    Netgear's Arlo unit files for IPO; shares +3%

    • Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR) camera unit Arlo Technologies has filed its registration statement for an initial public offering.
    • Shares in Netgear are up 3% after hours.
    • The company hasn't set a share number or price range (it has a placeholder amount of $100M), but is applying to list on the NYSE under the ticker ARLO.
    • The filing comes via lead managers BofA Merrill Lynch, Deutsche Bank Securities, and Guggenheim Securities, along with Raymond James, Cowen and Imperial Capital.
    • In its statement, the company notes it has 1.9M registered Arlo users and 40% market share in the U.S. consumer network-connected camera systems market.
    • In selected combined financial data, the company notes revenue for the three months ended April 1 was $100.6M (up 63% Y/Y) and gross profit rose to $29.1M from $16.35M. It points to a net loss of $5.36M with higher expenses, including separation expense.
    • In competition, Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN) looms large, as it not only supplies the AWS platform for Arlo but produces the competing Cloud Cam and bought two other competitors (Blink and Ring). Other competitors include Nest (GOOG, GOOGL), Swann, Night Owl, Belkin (OTC:FXCOF), Samsung (OTC:SSNLF), D-Link and Canary.
    • S-1 registration
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 12 Comments

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (7/6/2018)

    • Top Gainers: SENS +3.2%. ENIA +2%. MX +2%. PLAB +1.2%. PLAY +1.2%.
    • Top Losers: UNIT -5.5%. OTCQB:MOMT -3.2%. GLUU -2.8%. AMTD -2.7%. PEGA -2.2%.

  • WWE

    BTIG boosts target on WWE after TV deal

    • World Wrestling Entertainment (NYSE:WWE) moved up another 1.7% today, building on a rise it started last week after announcing new flagship TV deals for its network programming in the U.S.
    • BTIG has raised its price target to $92, pointing to international prospects that could lead to similar deal breakthroughs in the UK and India.
    • That target implies 20% more upside in shares.
    • Since the news broke on the new deals, shares are up 15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • RVI

    Retail Value sells Tequesta Shoppes for $14.3M

    • Retail Value (NYSE:RVI) closes on the sale of Tequesta Shoppes in Tequesta, FL, for $14.3M and will use the proceeds to repay mortgage debt associated with RVI.
    • After the closing, RVI owns interests in 35 properties located in the continental U.S. and 12 properties in Puerto Rico.
    • RVI rose 6% in regular-hours trading today, its eighth day of trading after being spun off from DDR (DDR). Shares are up 0.14% in after-hours trading.
    • Previously: DDR down as spinoff Retail Value poised to start regular-way trading today (July 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 6 Comments
  • CVEO

    Civeo contract adds to evidence that LNG Canada project will proceed

    • Analysts say Civeo's (CVEO +7.2%) contract award to supply workforce accommodations is a strong sign that the Royal Dutch Shell-led (RDS.A, RDS.B) LNG Canada project is headed for a positive final investment decision later this year, Financial Post reports.
    • CIBC analysts say the contract award adds to evidence that partners in the project will agree to proceed, noting that CVEO already was awarded conditional contracts for a 440-bed permanent facility at Kitimat and a 4,500-bed temporary camp for the export terminal construction phase.
    • Last month, pipeline owner TransCanada awarded the construction contract for the pipeline to a consortium, also on the condition of a positive investment decision on LNG Canada.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 3 Comments
  • TNTR-OLD

    Tintri -16.8% with buyers failing to appear

    • Tintri (NASDAQ:TNTR-OLD) is down another 16.8% today as a (relatively) slow-motion collapse continues.
    • The company said in mid-June that it likely didn't have liquidity to continue operations past June 30.
    • After hopes of a white knight buyer arriving, today brings a detailed look into previously unreported management missteps and discord at the company by The Information.
    • Current market cap (for a company once valued at $800M) is just under $8M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • BBOX

    Black Box doubles up after announcing biggest deal

    • Black Box's (NASDAQ:BBOX) rebound continues after a 63% tumble on Tuesday's liquidity warning.
    • Shares are up 115% today, making up the entire loss from this week and hitting its highest point in nine days. The stock closed at $2.03 on Monday before falling to $0.75 Tuesday; they're back up to $2.03 currently.
    • The company today says it's been awarded a $10M-plus data center project for "the most well-known social media company in the world," with potential data center work that it says could total $300M or more -- the largest customer and deal in company history.
    • The deal marks a five- to 10-year relationship between the two, Black Box says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 12 Comments
  • LFIN

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.50 PM (07/06/2018)

    • Gainers: OTCPK:LFIN +30%. IMI +7%. MJCO +7%. CRNT +7%. EGAN +7%.
    • Losers: ABIL -9%. MARK -8%. LINK -7%. SMSI -7%. FTNW -7%.

  • PCG

    PG&E higher on report that a court says not liable for 2015 Butte wildfire

    • PG&E (PCG +1.6%) enjoys a bump after Citigroup analyst Praful Mehta says the Sacrament Superior court ruled the utility is not liable for punitive damages related to the Butte wildfire, which he believes sets a positive precedent for PG&E and other California utilities in terms of the 2015 fires.
    • No further details are available.
    • Mehta keeps a Neutral rating on the shares, saying the Tubbs fire outcome and potential impact of legislation remain the key drivers of the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 7 Comments
  • TTI

    Tetra Technologies +4% as B. Riley FBR starts at Buy

    • Tetra Technologies (TTI +4.2%) is initiated with a Buy rating and a $8 price target at B. Riley FBR, which believes leading positions in three markets make the company an "EBITDA engine."
    • Riley says TTI's leadership positions should enable it to grow adjusted EBITDA at a 28% compound annual growth rate through 2019 with clear potential upside, and notes that the company has begun to commercialize a breakthrough high-density fluid, CS Neptune, with explosive sales potential.
    • The firm views TTI as the third-largest player in the onshore U.S. contract compression business, where demand is structurally accelerating and the current up-cycle has just reached its sweet spot.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • SFIX

    New high for Stitch Fix after runaway week

    • Stich Fix (SFIX +7.5%) runs to a new post-IPO high of $31.60 as more positive signs emerge that the brand is taking hold with younger consumers.
    • The retailer is up 13% this week alone and has more than doubled from its low last December.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 18 Comments
  • BABA

    Baird trims Alibaba estimates on FX, macro slowdown

    • Baird has trimmed estimates for Alibaba's (NYSE:BABA) first quarter, with eyes toward currency effects and a broader macro slowdown in retail sales.
    • Analyst Colin Sebastian has cut expectations for Q1 revenue to 79.8B yuan from 83B, and trimmed EPS to 9.04 yuan from 9.28 yuan.
    • Comps should be easier in the second half, he writes, trimming the full fiscal year revenue estimate to 391.8B yuan and EPS to 39.93 yuan.
    • China's statistic bureau expects online retail sales growth to slow to 30.7% YTD (vs. 32.4% through April, and a year-ago 32.5%). And renminbi depreciation could lead to more than 1B yuan in foreign-exchange losses for the quarter, Sebastian says. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • MKM Partners advised yesterday not to worry about weak renminbi and buy the dip.
    • Alibaba is up 2.3% today; nearly all analysts have Buy ratings on the stock, including Sebastian.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 20 Comments

    Midday Gainers / Losers (07/06/2018)

    • Gainers: XBIO +33%. ACIU +33%. OTCPK:LFIN +29%. TAIT +24%. ARQL +19%. MNOV +18%. MOTS +17%. BIIB +16%. ATOS +13%. LFVN +12%.

  • MANT

    ManTech +8% as SunTrust upgrades on federal budget benefits

    • ManTech International (MANT +7.8%) surges after SunTrust Robinson Humphrey upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $66 price target, up from $60, citing the company's "superior positioning to further accelerate market share gains and capitalize on federal budget increases."
    • SunTrust also expects MANT's more lucrative materials contracts to expand the company's EBITDA margins by as much as 20 bps/year from its forecast of 8.6% this year toward the 9.5% industry average, prompting the firm to raise its FY 2019 EPS target to $2.25 from $2.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • FMCXF

    Foran Mining completes $9.4M private placement

    • Foran Mining (OTC:FMCXF) has completed the second and final tranche of its non-brokered private placement.
    • The final tranche consisted of ~4.52M common shares on a flow-through basis at a price of $0.66 per FT Share for gross proceeds of ~$2.98M.
    • The gross proceeds from the issuance of FT Shares will be used to incur Canadian exploration expenses.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • TCYSF

    More on TECSYS Q4 results

    • TECSYS (OTCPK:TCYSF +0.8%) reported Q4 revenue of C$18.91M (+2.5% Y/Y).
    • Segment revenue: Proprietary products C$3.1M (+16% Y/Y), Cloud, maintenance and subscription was flat at C$6.9M; Professional services C$6.5M (+6% Y/Y) and Third-party Products C$1.94M (-10.8% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Overall margins: Gross was flat at 51%, operating declined by 2,355 bps to 9.25% and EBITDA decline by 2,398 bps to 12.2%.
    • Q4 Expenses: Selling & marketing C$3.68M (-10.2% Y/Y); G&A C$1.5M (+14.8% Y/Y) and R&D C$2.58M company recognized a C$4.6M of prior year federal non-refundable R&D tax credits which reduced gross R&D expenditures by a corresponding amount.
    • Contract booking increased by 32.7% Y/Y to C$14.73M.
    • Cash and cash equivalent along with redeemable long term investments was C$23.5M as of April 30, 2018.
    • Previously: Tecsys reports Q4 results (July 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • RHHBY

    Big Pharma in the green on Biogen's bullish news

    • Investors are not forgetting Big Pharma in today's rally. Like other groups, all are in the green.

  • MBT

    Mobile TeleSystems increased it's stake in MTS Bank

    • MTS’s  (MBT -3.9%) wholly-owned subsidiary Mobile TeleSystems B.V. acquired a stake in MTS Bank from Sistema PJSFC and the CIS and the majority shareholder of MTS for RUB8.27B.
    • As a result of the deal, MTS’s share in MTS Bank increased from 26.61% to 55.24%. Sistema’s direct ownership in MTS Bank decreased from 71.87% to 43.24%, while the balance of shares are held by other shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 5 Comments
  • IMASY

    EchoStar backs off of pursuit for Inmarsat

    • Following the rejection of an improved offer to buy Inmarsat (IMASY -8.6%), EchoStar (SATS +1.8%) says it doesn't intend to make an offer for the UK-based provider.
    • That comes in a filing related to UK takeover code.
    • EchoStar's announcement makes it bound by restrictions in the takeover code, with some exceptions (such as if Inmarsat's board agrees, or a firm intention of an offer for Inmarsat by a third party).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • ISRG

    Med devices group joins broad rally

    • Medical device makers are rallying in concert with biotechs.

  • SIIGY

    SIG falls after Canaccord reels in estimates

    • SIG Plc. (OTC:SIIGY) falls after Canaccord Genuity drops EPS estimates on a lack of confidence that margin improvement is around the corner.
    • Shares of SIG fell 3.83% in London today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • BIIB

    Biogen leads biotechs into positive territory

    • Biotechs are enjoying an up day, stoked by Biogen's (BIIB +14.8%) positive data on Alzheimer's candidate BAN2401. The SPDR S&P Biotech ETF (XBI +2.5%) has rallied 9% in a week.
    • Selected tickers: (BIB +6.2%)(FBT +2.7%)(FBT +2.7%)(BBH +2.5%)(AMGN +2%)(VRTX +1.7%)(GILD +3.3%)(CELG +2.1%)(DRNA +1.5%)(FPRX +2.4%)(GBT +3.5%)(INCY +1.9%)(XON +4.9%)(CRSP +1.3%)(EDIT +2.8%)(NTLA +4.7%)(UTHR +1.5%)(SAGE +0.6%)(REGN +1.3%)(PBYI +1.2%)(NKTR +0.2%)(EXAS +1.4%)(BPMC +1.2%)(TSRO +3.4%)(CLVS +3.2%)(GLPG +3.2%)(BLUE +2.3%)(ALKS +4.6%)(IONS +4.5%)(ALNY +3.2%)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 33 Comments
  • TUSK

    Mammoth Energy +5% as Barclays boosts price target

    • Mammoth Energy Services (TUSK +5.7%) powers higher after Barclays maintains its Overweight rating and raises its stock price target to $49 from $42, reflecting increased confidence in the duration and probability of TUSK’s contracts with Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority.
    • Under a "blue sky scenario" in Puerto Rico, Barclays sees as much as ~85% equity upside potential from current levels, assuming TUSK continues to perform reconstruction work through 2019 generating a revenue run rate of $300M/quarter at 25% margins, leading to $1.2B of revenue and $300M in EBITDA.
    • Earlier this week, Imperial Capital kept its Outperform rating and $46 price target on TUSK, saying the company's recent equity offering by selling shareholders should be a long-term positive as it should improve the trading metrics of the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • LKSD

    LSC Communications -11.9% on JPMorgan downgrade

    • LSC Communications (NYSE:LKSD) is giving back a few weeks of gains today, down 11.9% after JPMorgan downgraded shares to Underweight.
    • The stock is up 25.5% over the past month, but that's unsustainable, says analyst Alexia Quadrani. The company may not be able to realize cost synergies as expected, and she wants to see fundamentals improve in its core business. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • She has a $14 price target; shares have fallen to $14.31 today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • ATUS

    UFP: Altice USA at discount from fundamental value

    • Altice USA (NYSE:ATUS) is discounted from its long-term fundamentals, United First Partners says in a note seeing 15% upside.
    • Shares are up 3.8% and today hitting their highest point in nearly a month.
    • Analyst Ivan Deryugin says "flowback" of shares from the company's separation from its parent (now Altice Europe) likely caused underperformance, but the U.S. arm now has more financial flexibility to deploy capital. He values ATUS at $21/share in a case that assigns zero credit to the company's net operating losses. (h/t Bloomberg)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • BIIB

    Leerink's Porges not on board with Biogen's positive trial results for Alzheimer's candidate BAN2401

    • Leerink's Geoff Porges is not sold on Biogen (BIIB +16.2%) and development partner Eisai's (OTCPK:ESALY +18.6%) positive 18-month data from a Phase 2 clinical assessing amyloid beta monoclonal antibody BAN2401 in patients with early Alzheimer's disease. He says the jury is still out considering the lack of external validation of of the ADCOMS endpoint and absence of details about other cognitive measures.
    • This is the same study that failed to demonstrate a statistically valid treatment effect at month 12.
    • Previously: Biogen's Alzheimer's candidate BAN2401 flunks mid-stage study (Dec. 21, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 8 Comments
  • FDX

    Wolfe Research updates on FedEx

    • Wolfe Research updates on FedEx (FDX -0.9%) after meeting with the company's IR director.
    • Analyst Scott Group: "FDX continues to see strong volume and pricing trends in the U.S. and continued strength in Asia, but some signs of a slowdown in Europe. FDX also sounded confident in its F20 Express guidance and upbeat that Ground margins should continue to improve to at least the mid-teens. Trade wars are a potential overhang, but we estimate modest U.S.-China exposure at ~5% of consolidated revenue."
    • The strong assessment on FDX arrives with shares of the shipper down 9.3% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • XBIO

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (07/06/2018)

    • Gainers: XBIO +38%. ACIU +37%. MNOV +16%. BIIB +15%. ARQL +14%.
    • Losers: HAIR -10%. CTRV -10%. CVRS -9%. PTIE -8%. MYO -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • KL

    Kirkland Lake Gold reports new high-grade intersections at Macassa mine

    • Kirkland Lake Gold (KL +2%) moves higher after reporting new high-grade drill intersections from underground exploration drilling at its Macassa gold mine in Ontario.
    • The new results involve 20 holes for 7,560 m of underground drilling from the east exploration drift on the 5300-ft. level; underground drilling from the 5300 level will continue throughout 2018.
    • KL says the results support further mineral resource expansion, as all but two of the intersections are located outside of the existing mineral resource blocks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 8 Comments

  • EIA Natural Gas Inventory

    • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: +78 Bcf vs. +75 Bcf consensus, +66 Bcf last week.
    • Futures +0.25% to $2.844.
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, KOLD, UNL.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 26 Comments
  • CLDC

    China Lending loses 30% after direct placement of $2M in stocks and warrants

    • China Lending Corp. (NASDAQ:CLDC) dives 30% after the micro-lending company  agreed to sell $2.0M of ordinary shares at $2.60 each in a direct placement with two institutional shareholders. Shares are currently selling at about $2.28 each.
    • CLDC will issue 769,232 ordinary shares to the two investors and will issue series A warrants to buy up to 576,924 ordinary shares at an exercise price of $2.60 per share. The warrants have a term of four years.
    • In connection with the offering, the investors will also get Series B warrants to purchase up to 462,843 ordinary shares. If on the 30th day after the deal's closing date, the closing stock price of ordinary shares is less than $2.60, the investors will have the right to exercise the Series B warrants for nominal consideration.
    • CLDC reached its 52-week high of $7.75 nine days ago on June 27.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: China Lending more than doubles on heavy volume (June 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • CCF

    More on Chase's Q3 results

    • Chase Corporation (CCF +1.7%) reported Q3 revenue growth of 21.6% Y/Y to $78.92M reflecting strong organic and inorganic sales growth.
    • Industrial materials segment: Revenue $65.39M (+22.7% Y/Y) and gross margin declined by 371 bps to 38.3%.
    • Construction materials segment: Revenue $13.53M (+16.5% Y/Y) and gross margin declined by 151 bps to 42%.
    • Q3 Overall operating margin declined by 176 bps to 21.5% and Adj. EBITDA margin declined by 103 bps to 27.9%
    • SG&A expenses were $13.7M up by 11.5% Y/Y.
    • Cash on hand as of May 31, 2018 was $33.1M
    • Company announced closure of Pawtucket, RI manufacturing plant. The operations will transition to Oxford, MA and Lenoir, NC locations.
    • "Our second quarter acquisition, Zappa Stewart, delivered on the top and bottom lines, producing margins accretive to our relative average. Despite contracted margins on a percentage basis, the growth in overall sales volume in the third quarter produced increased operating income over the prior year. Our overall earnings were also aided by the sale of our structural composites rod business in April, which continued our divestment of non-core businesses, while both providing us with a one-time gain and securing a royalty agreement to provide for future cash inflows", commented Adam P. Chase, President and CEO.
    • Previously: Chase reports Q3 results (July 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • DRYS

    DryShips tracks higher

    • DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) is up 5.07% as shares pop back over $6.00 for the first time in two weeks.
    • The shipper has had a good run so far in 2018, up 76% on improved sentiment.
    • The last sleet update from DryShips showed that it was operating a fleet of 36 vessels comprised of 11 Panamax drybulk vessels, 5 Newcastlemax drybulk vessels, 5 Kamsarmax drybulk vessels, 1 Very Large Crude Carrier, 2 Aframax tankers, 2 Suezmax tanker, 4 Very Large Gas Carriers and 6 Offshore Support Vessels, including 2 Platform Supply and 4 Oil Spill Recovery Vessels.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 19 Comments
  • VTVT

    Alzheimer's players in the green on Biogen news

    • Most players in the Alzheimer's disease space are in the green after Biogen announced positive mid-stage data on BAN2401.
    • Selected tickers: (VTVT +6.2%)(TNXP +0.2%)(ACAD +5.9%)(AXSM +1.5%)(ACIU +34.3%)(DNLI -0.1%)(WVE +1.8%)(OTCPK:TKPHF)(VYGR +2.9%)(ABBV +1.5%)(MRK +0.6%)(AVXL -4.6%)(OTCQX:IGXT)(AMGN +1.1%)(OTCPK:ESALY +18.5%)(IONS +2.2%)(AXON -2.7%)(BHVN +1.9%)
    • Previously: Biogen +6% after Alzheimer's drug succeeds in trial (July 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 26 Comments
  • ACIU

    Biogen bullishness spreads to AC Immune, up 32%

    • Thinly traded AC Immune (ACIU +32.4%) is up a 16x surge in volume in apparent concert with Biogen's (BIIB +17.9%) rally related to positive Phase 2 data on early Alzheimer's candidate BAN2401, a humanized anti-amyloid beta protofil monoclonal antibody.
    • One of AC Immune's Alzheimer's candidates is crenezumab, in Phase 3 development by licensee Genentech, a humanized monoclonal antibody that binds to all forms of misfolded proteins, including Tau and beta amyloid.
    • Previously: Biogen +6% after Alzheimer's drug succeeds in trial (July 5)
    • Previously: Biogen's Alzheimer's candidate BAN2401 flunks mid-stage study (Dec. 21, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • PSMT

    PriceSmart -10% after bottom line disappoints

    • PriceSmart (PSMT -9.9%) is down sharply in early trading after FQ3 results disappointed.
    • The company only missed EPS estimates by $0.02, but net income was slightly lower than a year ago as SG&A expenses bit into profitability.
    • Shares have traded as low as $83.58 this morning, compared to the 52-week trading range of $77.50 to $94.45.
    • Previously: PriceSmart misses by $0.02, beats on revenue (July 5)
    • Previously: Sales track higher at PriceSmart (July 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 1 Comment

  • Canada adds more jobs than expected in June

    • Canada added 31.8K jobs in June, topping estimates for 20K, and more than reversing a loss of 7.5K jobs in May.
    • The unemployment rate, however, rose to 6% from 5.8%.
    • Given the mixed numbers, as well as a mixed report on U.S. jobs earlier, the loonie (NYSE:FXC) has been all over the place, first strengthening, then weakening, and now about flat on the session.
    • Bottom line: Neither the U.S., nor the Canadian numbers are likely to come close to pulling either central bank out of its tightening cycle.
    • ETFs: EWC, CNDA, EWCS, QCAN, FCAN, HEWC, FLCA
    • Previously: Labor force participation leads to big jump in unemployment rate (July 6)
    • Previously: 213K jobs added in June; UE rate jumps to 4% (July 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • IQ

    IQiyi -6% on report Baidu to sell $259M worth

    • IQiyi (NASDAQ:IQ) is 6% lower premarket after a report that major shareholder Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) filed to trim its shareholding by $259M.
    • The company registered to sell 7.2M American Depositary Shares, according to reports.
    • Baidu had held a 69.6% stake in the streaming service before its March initial public offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 115 Comments
  • GBR

    Premarket Losers as of 9:05 am (07/06/2018)

    • GBR -7%.
    • UXIN -6%.
    • IQ -6%.
    • MBT -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 12 Comments
  • RGSE

    RGS Energy +17% as new solar shingle system passes UL Class A Fire tests

    • RGS Energy (NASDAQ:RGSE) +17% premarket after reporting that its new Powerhouse 3.0 solar shingle system passed UL tests for Class A Fire, the highest Fire rating available.
    • RGSE says it plans to begin sales and installation of Powerhouse 3.0 solar shingles immediately following UL 1703 certification.
    • RGSE says it has received written reservations for $42M in potential annual revenue, averaging $1.5M/day in new reservations since the previous announcement.

    Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am (06/07/2018)

    • BIIB +13% on positive analyst action.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM

  • Labor force participation leads to big jump in unemployment rate

    • First taking a look at the establishment data, 213K jobs were added in June vs. expectations for 200K. Revisions added a total of 37K jobs to the April and May reports. We'll call things on this front a modest beat.
    • The average workweek was flat at 34.5 hours, and average hourly earnings rose a nickel to $26.98; the year-over-year increase was 2.7% vs. expectations of 2.8%.
    • Turning to the household data, the headline unemployment rate unexpectedly rose to 4% from 3.8%. This was mostly thanks to a gain in the denominator of the unemployment equation - the labor force grew by 601K, bringing the labor force participation rate to 62.9% from 62.7%.
    • The broader U-6 unemployment rate rose to 7.8% from 7.6%. One year ago, it was 8.5%.
    • The knee-jerk reaction of markets suggest they're focused for now on the big move in the unemployment rate - yields (TLT, TBT) and the dollar (UUP, UDN) have moved lower, while gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) has edged higher. Also moving modestly higher since the number are S&P 500 (NYSEARCA:SPY) futures, now barely in the green for the session.
    • Previously: 213K jobs added in June; UE rate jumps to 4% (July 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 66 Comments
